intro: Helichrysum declinatum, commonly known as the silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it suitable for rocky or well-drained soils. Its fluffy, long-lasting flowers are popular in floral arrangements. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
